com.bitwig.base.control_surface.iface

Interface Host


  • public interface Host
    An interface representing the host application to the script.

    • Method Detail

      • addDeviceNameBasedDiscoveryPair

        void addDeviceNameBasedDiscoveryPair(String[] inputs,
                                   String[] outputs)
        Define that the controller can be discovered from the name of the midi in/out drivers.. Can be called (at the global scope) multiple times to define multiple driver names but is optional.
        Parameters:
        inputs -
        outputs -

                       int port,
                       org.mozilla.javascript.Callable callback)
                         throws com.bitwig.base.control_surface.ControlSurfaceException
        Connect to a remote TCP socket. The callback will receive a RemoteConnection instance on connection.

        port -
        callback -

      • defineController

        void defineController(String vendor,
                    String name,
                    String version,
                    String uuid)
                      throws com.bitwig.base.control_surface.ControlSurfaceException
        Define the controller. Must be called at the global scope of the script.
        Parameters:

        uuid -
        Throws:
        com.bitwig.base.control_surface.ControlSurfaceException

      • defineMidiPorts

        void defineMidiPorts(int numInports,
                   int numOutports)

      • defineSysexDiscovery

        @Deprecated
void defineSysexDiscovery(String request,
                                   String reply)
        Deprecated. 
        Define the controller scripts sysex discovery "identity request" and "identity reply" messages it listens to. Must be called at the global scope of the script, but is optional. This method is deprecated and will be removed in the future in order to prevent detection from taking too long Use driver-name based discovery instead or defineSysexIdentityReply
        Parameters:
        request -
        reply -

      • defineSysexIdentityReply

        void defineSysexIdentityReply(String reply)
        Define the sysex "identity reply" message (if any) that the MIDI device sends after receiving the standard Identity Request (F0 7E 7F 06 01 F7) message Must be called at the global scope of the script, but is optional. Only applicable to scripts with 1 MIDI in and 1 MIDI out
        Parameters:
        reply -

      • showPopupNotification

        void showPopupNotification(String text)
        Show a temporary text overlay on top of the application GUI. Will fade-out after a short interval. If the overlay is already shown, it will get updated with the new text.
        Parameters:
        text -
